description: Unit of measurement for the reported value.
Quantifiable attribute or subject; description of what is being recorded.
Unique identifier for a variable, joinable to the timeseries table. This variable combines the World Bank dataset abbreviation with the unique timeseries code (provided by the World Bank).
Human-readable unique name for the variable.
Either Environmental, Social, or Governance, if the variable is ESG-related (e.g., Worldwide Development Indicators).
Array of topics associated with the variable, according to the World Bank.
Note about the variable from the source of the data, often pertaining to how the variable is measured.
The World Bank data series that this variable belongs to.
The source of the data as reported by the World Bank. The World Bank aggregates many of their tracked statistics from other international organizations.
